trans-unit.source: Sample Data in SQL Server on Azure | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Sample Data in SQL Server on Azure | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Sample Data in SQL Server on Azure
trans-unit.target: Sample Data in SQL Server on Azure

trans-unit.source: Sample data in SQL Server on Azure
trans-unit.target: Sample data in SQL Server on Azure

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: This document shows how to sample data stored in SQL Server on Azure using either SQL or the Python Programming Language.
trans-unit.target: This document shows how to sample data stored in SQL Server on Azure using either SQL or the Python Programming Language.

trans-unit.source: It also shows how to move sampled data into Azure Machine Learning by saving it to a file, uploading it to an Azure blob, and then reading it into Azure Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: It also shows how to move sampled data into Azure Machine Learning by saving it to a file, uploading it to an Azure blob, and then reading it into Azure Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: The Python sampling uses the [pyodbc](https://code.google.com/p/pyodbc/) ODBC library to connect to SQL Server on Azure and the[Pandas](http://pandas.pydata.org/) library to do the sampling.
trans-unit.target: The Python sampling uses the [pyodbc](https://code.google.com/p/pyodbc/) ODBC library to connect to SQL Server on Azure and the[Pandas](http://pandas.pydata.org/) library to do the sampling.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The sample SQL code in this document assumes that the data is in a SQL Server on Azure.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The sample SQL code in this document assumes that the data is in a SQL Server on Azure.

trans-unit.source: If it is not, please refer to [Move data to SQL Server on Azure](machine-learning-data-science-move-sql-server-virtual-machine.md) topic for instructions on how to move your data to SQL Server on Azure.
trans-unit.target: If it is not, please refer to [Move data to SQL Server on Azure](machine-learning-data-science-move-sql-server-virtual-machine.md) topic for instructions on how to move your data to SQL Server on Azure.

trans-unit.source: **Why sample your data?** If the dataset you plan to analyze is large, it is usually a good idea to down-sample the data to reduce it to a smaller but representative and more manageable size.
trans-unit.target: **Why sample your data?** If the dataset you plan to analyze is large, it is usually a good idea to down-sample the data to reduce it to a smaller but representative and more manageable size.

trans-unit.source: This facilitates data understanding, exploration, and feature engineering.
trans-unit.target: This facilitates data understanding, exploration, and feature engineering.

trans-unit.source: Its role in the Cortana Analytics Process is to enable fast prototyping of the data processing functions and machine learning models.
trans-unit.target: Its role in the Cortana Analytics Process is to enable fast prototyping of the data processing functions and machine learning models.

trans-unit.source: The **menu** below links to topics that describe how to sample data from various storage environments.
trans-unit.target: The **menu** below links to topics that describe how to sample data from various storage environments.

trans-unit.source: This sampling task is a step in the [Cortana Analytics Process (CAP)](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/learning-paths/cortana-analytics-process/).
trans-unit.target: This sampling task is a step in the [Cortana Analytics Process (CAP)](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/learning-paths/cortana-analytics-process/).

trans-unit.source: Using SQL
trans-unit.target: Using SQL

trans-unit.source: This section describes several methods using SQL to perform simple random sampling against the data in the database.
trans-unit.target: This section describes several methods using SQL to perform simple random sampling against the data in the database.

trans-unit.source: Please choose a method based on your data size and its distribution.
trans-unit.target: Please choose a method based on your data size and its distribution.

trans-unit.source: The two items below show how to use newid in SQL Server to perform the sampling.
trans-unit.target: The two items below show how to use newid in SQL Server to perform the sampling.

trans-unit.source: The method you choose depends on how random you want the sample to be (pk_id in the sample code below is assumed to be an auto-generated primary key).
trans-unit.target: The method you choose depends on how random you want the sample to be (pk_id in the sample code below is assumed to be an auto-generated primary key).

trans-unit.source: Less strict random sample
trans-unit.target: Less strict random sample

trans-unit.source: More random sample
trans-unit.target: More random sample

trans-unit.source: Tablesample can be used for sampling as well as demonstrated below.
trans-unit.target: Tablesample can be used for sampling as well as demonstrated below.

trans-unit.source: This may be a better approach if your data size is large (assuming that data on different pages is not correlated) and for the query to complete in a reasonable time.
trans-unit.target: This may be a better approach if your data size is large (assuming that data on different pages is not correlated) and for the query to complete in a reasonable time.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can explore and generate features from this sampled data by storing it in a new table
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can explore and generate features from this sampled data by storing it in a new table

trans-unit.source: Connecting to Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: Connecting to Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: You can directly use the sample queries above in the Azure ML Reader module to down-sample the data on the fly and bring it into an Azure ML experiment.
trans-unit.target: You can directly use the sample queries above in the Azure ML Reader module to down-sample the data on the fly and bring it into an Azure ML experiment.

trans-unit.source: A screen shot of using the reader module to read the sampled data is shown below:
trans-unit.target: A screen shot of using the reader module to read the sampled data is shown below:

trans-unit.target: ![reader sql][1]

trans-unit.source: Using the Python programming language
trans-unit.target: Using the Python programming language

trans-unit.source: This section demonstrates using the [pyodbc library](https://code.google.com/p/pyodbc/) to establish an ODBC connect to a SQL server database in Python.
trans-unit.target: This section demonstrates using the [pyodbc library](https://code.google.com/p/pyodbc/) to establish an ODBC connect to a SQL server database in Python.

trans-unit.source: The database connection string is as follows: (replace servername, dbname, username and password with your configuration):
trans-unit.target: The database connection string is as follows: (replace servername, dbname, username and password with your configuration):

trans-unit.source: The [Pandas](http://pandas.pydata.org/) library in Python provides a rich set of data structures and data analysis tools for data manipulation for Python programming.
trans-unit.target: The [Pandas](http://pandas.pydata.org/) library in Python provides a rich set of data structures and data analysis tools for data manipulation for Python programming.

trans-unit.target: You can now work with the sampled data in the Pandas data frame.

trans-unit.source: Connecting to Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: Connecting to Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: You can use the following sample code to save the down-sampled data to a file and upload it to an Azure blob.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following sample code to save the down-sampled data to a file and upload it to an Azure blob.

trans-unit.source: The data in the blob can be directly read into an Azure ML Experiment using the *Reader Module*.
trans-unit.target: The data in the blob can be directly read into an Azure ML Experiment using the *Reader Module*.

trans-unit.source: The steps are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The steps are as follows:

trans-unit.target: Write the pandas data frame to a local file

trans-unit.target: Upload local file to Azure blob
